issues_found.description: Incomplete viewport units guidance - Research.json showed detailed information about dvh, svh, lvh usage patterns and fallback requirements, but spec.md only mentioned them without explaining when to use which or the critical fallback pattern for browser compatibility
issues_found.fix_applied:
Enhanced viewport units guidance with:
1. Code example showing fallback pattern (height: 100vh; height: 100dvh;)
2. Specific use cases for each unit (dvh for full-height sections, svh for address bar visibility, lvh for maximum height)
3. Clarified browser compatibility requirement for fallbacks

issues_found.description: Inconsistent terminology - Document used both 'tap targets' and 'touch targets' interchangeably throughout, which could confuse implementers. 'Touch targets' is the more standard term in web development
issues_found.location: Lines 20, 71, 170, and other locations throughout document
issues_found.fix_applied:
Standardized all instances to use 'touch targets' consistently:
- Line 20: 'tap target sizes' → 'touch target sizes'
- Line 71: 'tap target heights' → 'touch target heights'
- Line 170: Changed section title from 'Touch-Friendly Tap Targets' to 'Touch-Friendly Touch Targets'
- Line 172: 'tapped' → 'touched'

issues_found.description: Missing Radix UI mobile pattern - Research.json documented that Radix Tooltips should use onClick instead of hover on mobile for better touch UX, but this important pattern was not mentioned in the spec
issues_found.fix_applied: Added guidance: 'For Radix Tooltips on mobile: consider using onClick trigger instead of hover for better touch UX'

issues_found.description: Missing touch event gotcha - Research.json noted that touch events don't automatically prevent default behavior and may require manual handling for scrolling, but this was not documented in the spec
issues_found.fix_applied: Added note: 'Handle touch event defaults explicitly - touch events don't auto-prevent default, may need manual handling for scrolling interactions'

issues_found.description: Breakpoint notation could be clearer - Spec showed Tailwind's default breakpoints in px format (sm:640px) immediately after stating that breakpoints must use rem units, which could cause confusion about whether these needed to be converted
issues_found.fix_applied: Added clarifying note: 'Note: These defaults are already in rem units internally; only custom breakpoints need explicit rem definition' to make it clear that listed breakpoints are for reference only

critique_summary: Spec was well-structured and technically accurate overall. Found and fixed 6 issues: 2 medium-severity completeness gaps (missing files in modification table, incomplete viewport units guidance) and 4 low-severity issues (terminology inconsistency, missing Radix mobile pattern, missing touch event gotcha, breakpoint notation clarity). All issues were cross-referenced against research.json findings and resolved. The spec now has complete file coverage, comprehensive viewport units guidance with fallback patterns, consistent terminology, and includes important mobile-specific patterns from research.
recommendations: Consider adding a visual diagram or flowchart showing the responsive breakpoint transitions to help implementers visualize the layout changes
The QA section is very comprehensive - ensure the QA agent has access to real mobile devices or BrowserStack for the physical device testing requirements
Phase 6 (Testing & Optimization) mentions Lighthouse audits - consider documenting the specific Lighthouse flags/configuration to ensure consistent testing
Implementation Strategy is well-phased - recommend following the order strictly as later phases depend on foundation work in earlier phases
